feed.title: Google AI 博客;;来自 Google AI 的最新新闻。;;;;;;;;ewood;;http://www.blogger. com/profile/12341551220176883769;;noreply@blogger.com;;;;;Blogger;;1309;;1;;25;;;标签：blogger.com，1999：blog-8474926331452026626.post-6563276834599281497;<发布>;2023-11-17T11:36:00.000-08:00;<更新>;2023-11- 17T11:36:32.036-08:00;;;;;;;;以社会为中心的人工智能的新兴实践</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;由 Anoop Sinha 发布，技术与研究总监协会和 Google 研究部副总裁 Yossi Matias</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEghkgEei5l04Gs6hz4cLk9IqdDbXcx-41xZsRsJ-b2WHLDng1eZzJqo9eAwBZjZHc5P2akAKxT6v QLbn0-5nxy_OuPA5QIyWAV9Yy_4iIGch-zM2W-88Y-6e8HxkbG39hemnzheAx5GUvkMspUCaQiqE5RtxYvFKj- bI0pKzOhFVrWmSOgHJisYHBDfGdCl/s1200/lockup_GoogleResearch_FullColor_Hero.jpg" style="显示：无；" />; <p>; <a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/principles/">;Google 人工智能原则</a>;的第一条是“对社会有益”。作为人工智能从业者，我们受到人工智能技术的变革潜力的启发，人工智能技术能够以前所未有的规模和速度造福社会和我们的共享环境。从<a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/sustainability/google-ai-climate-change-solutions/">;帮助应对气候危机</a>;到<a href="https:// /blog.google/technology/health/how-were-using-ai-to-help-transform-healthcare/">;帮助医疗保健转型</a>;，<a href="https://blog.google/outreach -initiatives/accessibility/global-accessibility-awareness-day-google-product-update/">;让数字世界变得更加无障碍</a>;，我们的目标是负责任地应用人工智能，为全球更多的人提供帮助。实现全球规模需要研究人员和社区在整个人工智能生态系统中共同思考并采取行动。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 我们将这种方法称为“以社会为中心的人工智能”。它既是<a href="https://hcil.umd.edu/ human-centered-ai/">;以人为中心的人工智能的延伸和扩展，</a>;关注社会的总体需求仍然根据个人用户的需求提供信息，特别是在更大的、共享的人类经验的背景下。最近的人工智能进步提供了前所未有的社会层面的能力，如果我们将集体的、多学科的人工智能研究应用于社会层面的共同挑战，从预测饥饿到预测疾病，再到提高生产力，我们现在可以有条不紊地满足这些需求。 </p>; <p>; <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/documents/AI_Opportunity_Agenda.pdf">;人工智能造福社会的机会</a>;每增加一次天。我们审视了我们在这些领域的工作以及我们支持的研究项目。最近，Google <a href="https://research.google/outreach/air-program/recipients/">;宣布选出 70 名教授</a>;参加<a href="https://research.google /outreach/air-program/">;2023 年包容性研究计划奖</a>;，该计划支持满足全球历史上边缘化群体需求的学术研究。通过对这项工作的评估，我们确定了一些以社会为中心的人工智能的新兴实践：</p>; <ul>; <li>;<strong>;了解社会的需求</strong>; <br />;倾听社区和合作伙伴的意见对于深入理解重大问题并确定需要解决的优先挑战。作为一种新兴的通用技术，人工智能有潜力解决对人们生活产生重大影响的全球重大社会问题（例如，教育工人、改善医疗保健和提高生产力）。我们发现影响力的关键是以社会需求为中心。为此，我们将重点放在社会一致同意应优先考虑的目标上，例如联合国的<a href="https://globalgoals.withgoogle.com/globalgoals/globalgoals">;17 项可持续发展目标</a>;是由 190 多个国家共同制定的一系列相互关联的目标，旨在应对全球挑战。 </li>;<li>;<strong>;集体努力满足这些需求<br />;</strong>;集体努力将利益相关者（例如，当地和学术界、非政府组织、公私合作）纳入设计的联合过程，人工智能技术的开发、实施和评估，因为它们正在开发和部署以满足社会需求。 </li>;<li>;<strong>;通过努力满足社会需求的程度来衡量成功<br />;</strong>;衡量人工智能解决方案满足社会需求的程度非常重要且具有挑战性。在我们的每个案例中，我们都确定了通过与利益相关者合作优化的主要和次要影响指标。 </li>; </ul>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;为什么以社会为中心的人工智能很重要？</h2>; <p>; 案例下面描述的示例展示了以社会为中心的人工智能方法如何对无障碍、健康和气候等主题产生影响。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;了解言语不标准的个人的需求</h3>; <p>;有<a href="https://www.nidcd.nih.gov/health/statistics/quick-statistics-voice-speech-language">;数以百万计的人</a>;有不标准的言语（例如，发音障碍，<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dysarthria">;构音障碍</a>;、<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spasmodic_dysphonia">;发声困难</a>;）仅在美国。 <a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/accessibility/impaired-speech-recognition/">;2019 年</a>;，Google Research 推出了<a href="https://blog.research. google/2019/08/project-euphonias-personalized-speech.html">;Project Euphonia</a>;，一种允许使用非标准语音的个人用户训练个性化语音识别模型的方法。我们的成功始于我们对现在能够在移动设备上使用语音听写的每个人的影响。 </p>; <p>; Euphonia 从以社会为中心的人工智能方法开始，包括与非营利组织 <a href="http://als.net/">;ALS 治疗发展研究所</a>; 和<a href="http://www.alsri.org/">;ALS 居住计划</a>;，了解<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ALS" 患者的需求>;肌萎缩侧索硬化症</a>;（ALS）及其使用自动语音识别系统的能力。后来，我们开发了<a href="https://blog.research.google/2021/09/personalized-asr-models-from-large-and.html">;世界上最大的非标准语料库</a>;语音录音，这使我们能够训练<a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/03/universal-speech-model-usm-state-of-art.html">;通用语音模型</ a>;<a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/06/responsible-ai-at-google-research-ai.html">;真实识别混乱语音的能力提高 37%</a>;对话<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Word_error_rate">;单词错误率</a>; (WER) 测量。这也促成了伊利诺伊大学香槟分校、Alphabet 和 Apple 之间的 <a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/accessibility/speech-accessibility-project/">;2022</a>; 合作、Meta、微软和亚马逊启动<a href="https://speechaccessibilityproject.beckman.illinois.edu/">;语音无障碍项目</a>;，这是一项持续的计划，旨在创建一个公开的无序语音样本数据集改进产品并使语音识别更加包容不同的语音模式。其他使用人工智能帮助消除模式和语言障碍的技术包括<a href="https://about.google/stories/making-conversation-more-accessible-with-live-transcribe/">;实时转录</ a>;、<a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/accessibility/first-time-i-was-able-call-my-23-year-old-son/">;实时字幕</ a>; 和<a href="https://blog.google/intl/en-in/products/explore-communicate/easier-access-to-web-pages-let/">;大声朗读</a>;。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;关注社会健康需求</h3>; <p>;及时获取孕产妇健康信息可挽救生命全球：<a href="https://www.who.int/news/item/23-02-2023-a-woman-dies-every-two-mins- due-to-pregnancy-or-childbirth--联合国机构">;每两分钟就有一名妇女在怀孕或分娩期间死亡</a>;和<a href="https://data.unicef.org/topic/child-survival/under- Five-mortality/">;1 26 名儿童在五岁之前死亡</a>;。在印度农村地区，针对与怀孕和婴儿相关的关键健康问题对孕妇和新妈妈进行教育需要可扩展、低成本的技术解决方案。 Google Research 与 <a href="https://armman.org/">;ARMMAN</a>; 一起支持<a href="https://blog.research.google/2022/08/using-ml-to -boost-engagement-with.html">;该计划</a>;使用移动消息传递和机器学习 (ML) 算法来预测女性何时可以从接受干预措施（即有针对性的预防性护理信息）中受益，并鼓励她们参与<a href="https://armman.org/mmitra/">;mMitra</a>; 免费语音通话程序。一年之内，mMitra 计划显示出生体重增加三倍的婴儿数量增加了 17%，了解怀孕期间服用铁片重要性的女性数量增加了 36%。这一自动化解决方案已惠及超过 175,000 名母亲和成长中的母亲，公共卫生工作者利用该解决方案来提高信息传递的质量。 </p>; <p>; 由于社区和人工智能技术开发人员之间密切的集体合作伙伴关系，这些努力在改善健康方面取得了成功。我们通过与护理人员合作，采用了同样的方法来满足各种医疗需求。一些示例包括：使用<a href="https://health.google/caregivers/arda/">;自动视网膜疾病评估</a>; (ARDA) 来<a href="https://blog. google/technology/health/5-myths-about-medical-ai-debunked/">;帮助全世界诊所的 250,000 名患者筛查糖尿病视网膜病变</a>;；我们与 <a href="https://www.icadmed.com/">;iCAD</a>; 合作，将我们的<a href="https://blog.google/technology/ai/icad-partnership-breast -癌症筛查/">;乳房X线照相术</a>;人工智能模型应用于临床环境，以帮助乳腺癌检测；以及 <a href="https://sites.research.google/med-palm/">;Med-PaLM 2</a>; 的开发，这是一种医学大语言模型，目前正在<a href="https: //cloud.google.com/blog/topics/healthcare-life-sciences/sharing-google-med-palm-2-medical-large-language-model">;经过云合作伙伴测试</a>;，帮助医生提供更好的服务病人护理。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;持续努力应对危机所产生的复合影响</h3>; <p>; Google 研究开始开展洪水预测工作2018 年印度的<a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/helping-keep-people-safe-ai-enabled-flood-forecasting/">;洪水预报</a>;和< a href="https://www.undp.org/bangladesh/blog/climate-change-google-and-bangladesh-floods">;扩展到孟加拉国</a>;，以帮助应对每年洪水造成的灾难性破坏。最初的努力始于与<a href="https://cwc.gov.in/">;印度中央水务委员会</a>;、地方政府和社区的合作。这些工作的实施使用了搜索和地图上的 <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/helping-people-crisis/">;SOS 警报</a>;，并且最近更广泛地使用了通过<a href="https://sites.research.google/floods/l/0/0/3">;Flood Hub</a>;扩大访问范围。持续<a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/04/directing-ml-toward-natural-hazard.html">;合作</a>;并推进基于人工智能的全球洪水预报模型使我们能够<a href="https://blog.google/technology/ai/expanding-our-ml-based-flood-forecasting/">;将此功能扩展</a>;至<a href="https://blog .google/outreach-initiatives/sustainability/flood-hub-ai-flood-forecasting-more-countries/">;非洲、亚太地区、欧洲以及南部、中部和北部的 80 多个国家</a>;美国。我们还与社区志愿者网络合作，进一步加强洪水警报。通过与政府和社区合作衡量这些努力对社会的影响，我们每年都会改进我们的方法和算法。 </p>; <p>; 我们能够利用这些方法和一些底层技术，例如<a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/helping-people-crisis/">; SOS 警报</a>;，从<a href="https://sites.research.google/floodforecasting/">;洪水预报</a>;到类似的社会需求，例如<a href="https://blog .google/products/search/mapping-wildfires-with-satellite-data/">;野火预报</a>;和<a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/sustainability/extreme-heat-support /">;高温警报</a>;。我们与各组织的持续合作促成了<a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/sustainability/early-warning-system-wmo-google/">;对其他工作的支持</a>;，例如世界气象组织 (WMO) 的<a href="https://public.wmo.int/en/earlywarningsforall">;全民预警倡议</a>;。与社区的持续接触使我们能够随着时间的推移了解用户在社会层面的需求，扩大我们的努力，并扩大我们努力的社会影响力。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;进一步支持以社会为中心的人工智能研究</h2>; <p>; <a href="https: //research.google/outreach/air-program/recipients/">;我们最近资助了</a>; 18 项大学研究提案，这些提案体现了以社会为中心的人工智能方法，这是<a href="https://research 中的一个新方向.google/outreach/air-program/">;Google 包容性研究计划奖</a>;。这些研究人员正在采用以社会为中心的人工智能方法，并帮助在世界各地创建有益的应用程序。一些资助项目的例子包括：</p>; <ul>; <li>;<strong>;人工智能驱动的受冲突影响国家态度极化监测，以促进包容性和平进程和妇女赋权：</strong>;该项目的目标是创建由法学硕士支持的工具，可用于监控发展中国家在线对话的和平。最初的目标社区是和平不断变化的社区，这项工作将特别强调减轻影响妇女的两极分化和促进和谐。</li>; <li>;<strong>;人工智能辅助分布式协作室内污染计：案例研究印度社区的需求分析和低成本健康家居解决方案：</strong>;该项目正在研究如何使用低成本污染监测仪与人工智能辅助方法相结合，为社区和家庭提供改善空气质量的建议健康。最初的目标社区受到污染的严重影响，与他们的联合工作包括制定如何衡量当地社区成果改善的目标。 </li>; <li>;<strong>;协作开发人工智能解决方案，以扩大乌干达青少年获得性健康和生殖健康教育和服务的机会：</strong>;该项目的目标是创建法学硕士支持的工具，以提供个性化的指导和服务。满足用户对撒哈拉以南非洲低收入地区性健康和生殖健康教育主题的需求。当地社会需求巨大，估计<a href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9652643/">;少女怀孕率达到 25%</a>;，并且项目旨在通过人工智能解决方案的集体开发流程来满足需求。<strong>; </strong>; </li>; </ul>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; < /div>; <h2>;未来方向</h2>; <p>; 关注社会需求，通过多学科集体研究开展工作，并衡量对社会的影响，有助于形成相关、持久、赋权和有益的人工智能解决方案。请参阅<a href="https://globalgoals.withgoogle.com/globalgoals/">;人工智能实现全球目标</a>;，详细了解潜在的以社会为中心的人工智能研究问题。 <a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/google-org/httpsbloggoogleoutreach-initiativesgoogle-orgunited-nations-global-goals-google-ai-/">;我们与非营利组织的合作</a>;这些领域与我们正在开展和鼓励的研究相辅相成。我们相信，使用以社会为中心的人工智能的进一步举措将帮助集体研究社区解决问题并对整个社会产生积极影响。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;致谢</h2>; <p>; <em>;非常感谢许多参与此项目的人员这些 Google 项目包括 Shruti Sheth、Reena Jana、Amy Chung-Yu Chou、Elizabeth Adkison、Sophie Allweis、Dan Altman、Eve Andersson、Ayelet Benjamini</em>;、<em>;Julie Cattiau、Yuval Carny、Richard Cave、Katherine Chou , Greg Corrado, Carlos De Segovia, Remi Denton, Dotan Emanuel, Ashley Gardner, Oren Gilon, Taylor Goddu, Brigitte Hoyer Gosselink, Jordan Green, Alon Harris</em>;, <em>;Avinatan Hassidim, Rus Heywood, Sunny Jansen, Pan -潘江、安东·卡斯特、玛丽莲·拉德维格、罗尼特·莱维·莫拉德、鲍勃·麦克唐纳、艾丽西亚·马丁、沙基尔·穆罕默德、菲利普·尼尔森、莫里亚·罗伊兹、凯蒂·西弗、乔尔·肖尔、米林德·坦贝、阿帕娜·塔内贾、迪维·塔卡、吉米·托宾、卡特琳·托马内克、 Blake Walsh、Gal Weiss、Kasumi Widner、Lihong Xi 和团队。</em>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEghkgEei5l04Gs6hz4cLk9IqdDbXcx-41xZsRsJ-b2WHLDng1eZzJqo9eAwBZjZHc5P2akAKxT6vQLbn0-5nxy _OuPA5QIyWAV9Yy_4iIGch-zM2W-88Y-6e8HxkbG39hemnzheAx5GUvkMspUCaQiqE5RtxYvFKj-bI0pKzOhFVrWmSOgHJisYHBDfGdCl/s1200/ lockup_GoogleResearch_FullColor_Hero.jpg" style="显示：无；" />; <p>;<em>; </em>;<a href="https://research.google/teams/responsible-ai/">;负责任的人工智能和以人为本的技术</a>; (RAI-HCT) Google 研究团队致力于通过文化意识研究的视角推进负责任的以人为本的人工智能的理论和实践，以满足当今数十亿用户的需求，并为更美好的人工智能未来开辟道路。 RAI-HCT 内的 BRAIDS（构建负责任的 AI 数据和解决方案）团队旨在通过利用可扩展的工具、高质量数据、简化的流程和新颖的研究来简化 RAI 实践的采用，目前的重点是解决独特的挑战由<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generative_artificial_intelligence">;生成人工智能</a>; (GenAI) 提出。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; GenAI 模型实现了前所未有的功能，导致创新应用程序迅速激增。 Google 积极利用 <a href="https://ai.google/discover/foundation-models/">;GenAI</a>; 来<a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs /generative-ai/code/code-models-overview">;增强</a>;其<a href="https://workspace.google.com/blog/product-announcements/duet-ai-in-workspace-now -available">;产品的实用性</a>;并改善生活。 GenAI 带来巨大好处的同时，也带来了虚假信息、偏见和安全方面的风险。 2018 年，Google 率先提出了<a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/principles/">;人工智能原则</a>;，强调有益利用和预防伤害。自那时起，Google 一直致力于通过 1) 全面的风险评估框架有效落实我们在<a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/responsible-ai-practices/">;负责任的人工智能实践</a>;中的原则，2）内部治理结构，3）教育，使谷歌员工能够将人工智能原则融入到他们的工作中，以及4）开发用于识别、衡量和分析人工智能产品整个生命周期中道德风险的流程和工具。 BRAIDS 团队专注于最后一个领域，创建用于识别 GenAI 产品中道德和安全风险的工具和技术，使 Google 内部的团队能够应用适当的缓解措施。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;是什么让 GenAI 难以负责任地构建？</h2>; <p>; GenAI 模型前所未有的功能伴随着一系列新的潜在故障，凸显了在模型广泛使用之前采取全面、系统的 RAI 方法来理解和减轻潜在安全问题的紧迫性。用于了解潜在风险的一项关键技术是对抗性测试，该测试是为了系统地评估模型而进行的测试，以了解它们在一系列场景中被提供恶意或无意中有害的输入时的行为方式。为此，我们的研究集中在三个方向：</p>; <ol>; <li>;<em>;规模化对抗数据生成</em>;<br />; 考虑到不同的用户社区、用例和行为，它在推出产品或服务之前很难全面识别关键安全问题。人机交互的大规模对抗性数据生成通过创建包含各种不同且可能不安全的模型输入的测试集来满足这一需求，这些输入会在不利情况下强调模型的能力。我们在 BRAIDS 中的独特重点在于确定受我们的模型影响的不同用户社区的社会危害。 </li>; <li>;<em>;自动化测试集评估和社区参与</em>;<br />;扩展测试流程，以便快速评估数千个模型响应，以了解模型如何在广泛的范围内响应自动化测试集评估有助于发现潜在的有害场景。除了使用对抗性测试集进行测试之外，社区参与是我们识别“未知的未知数”并为数据生成过程提供种子的方法的关键组成部分。</li>; <li>;<em>;评估者多样性</em>;<br />;安全评估依赖于人的判断，而人的判断是由社区和文化塑造的，并且不容易自动化。为了解决这个问题，我们优先研究评估者多样性。</li>; </ol>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;规模化对抗数据生成</ h2>; <p>; 高质量、全面的数据支撑着 Google 的许多关键项目。最初依赖手动数据生成，我们在自动化对抗数据生成过程方面取得了重大进展。具有用例和政策一致提示的集中式数据存储库可用于快速启动新的对抗性测试的生成。我们还开发了多种基于大型语言模型 (LLM) 的合成数据生成工具，这些工具优先生成反映不同社会背景的数据集，并集成数据质量指标以提高数据集质量和多样性。 </p>; <p>; 我们的数据质量指标包括：</p>; <ul>; <li>;语言风格分析，包括查询长度、查询相似性和语言风格的多样性。</li>; <li>;跨维度的衡量广泛的社会和多元文化维度，利用 <a href="https://github.com/google-research-datasets/seegull/tree/main">;SeeGULL</a>;、<a href=" https://github.com/google-research-datasets/SPICE/tree/main">;SPICE</a>;，<a href="https://medium.com/jigsaw/scaling-machine-learning-fairness -with-societal-context-be73d4ad38e2">;社会情境存储库</a>;。</li>; <li>;衡量与 Google 的一致性<a href="https://policies.google.com/terms/generative-ai /use-policy">;生成式人工智能策略</a>;和预期用例。</li>; <li>;分析对抗性，以确保我们检查显式（输入明显设计为产生不安全的输出）和隐式（输入无害但输出有害）查询。 </li>; </ul>; <p>; 我们的大规模数据生成方法之一在我们关于<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.08592">;人工智能辅助红队</ a>;（AART）。 AART 生成具有高度多样性的评估数据集（例如，特定于广泛文化和地理区域的敏感和有害概念），并由人工智能辅助方法引导，以在应用程序环境中定义、范围和优先考虑多样性。与一些最先进的工具相比，AART 在概念覆盖率和数据质量方面显示出了有希望的结果。另外，我们还与 MLCommons 合作，为<a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/10/supporting-benchmarks-for-ai-safety.html">;人工智能安全公共基准做出贡献</一个>;。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;对抗性测试和社区见解</h2>; <p>; 使用对抗性测试集评估模型输出使我们能够在部署之前识别关键安全问题。我们的初步评估完全依赖于人工评级，由于缺乏标准化的安全定义和政策，导致周转时间缓慢且不一致。我们通过引入与政策一致的评估者指南来提高人类评估者的准确性，从而提高了评估的质量，并且正在研究其他改进措施，以更好地反映不同社区的观点。此外，使用基于 LLM 的自动评分器进行自动化测试集评估可提高效率和规模，同时允许我们将复杂或模糊的案例交给人类进行专家评分。 </p>; <p>; 除了使用对抗性测试集进行测试之外，收集社区见解对于不断发现“未知的未知数”至关重要。为了提供规模化流程所需的高质量人力投入，我们与 <a href="https://sites.google.com/corp/google.com/earr-external-research-group 等团体合作/home">;公平人工智能研究圆桌会议</a>; (EARR)，并与我们的内部道德和分析团队合作，以确保我们代表使用我们模型的多元化社区。 <a href="https://dynabench.org/tasks/adversarial-nibbler">;对抗性 Nibbler 挑战</a>;吸引外部用户了解<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs /2305.14384">;向最终用户大规模输出不安全、有偏见或暴力的内容</a>;。我们对社区参与的持续承诺包括收集不同社区的反馈并与研究社区合作，例如在<a href="https://sites.google.com/view/art-of-safety">;安全的艺术期间<a href="http://www.ijcnlp-aacl2023.org/">;计算语言学协会会议亚太分会</a>; (IJCNLP-AACL 2023) 举办的研讨会</a>;，以解决对抗性问题GenAI 的测试挑战。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;安全评估中的评估者多样性</h2>; <p>;了解和减轻 GenAI 安全风险既是技术和社会挑战。安全认知本质上是主观的，并受到多种交叉因素的影响。我们对人口统计对安全认知的影响进行了深入研究，探讨了<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.11530">;评估者人口统计数据的交叉影响</a>;（例如种族/民族、性别、年龄） ）和 GenAI 输出安全评估的内容特征（例如危害程度）。传统方法在很大程度上忽视了固有的主观性和评估者之间的系统性分歧，这可能掩盖重要的文化差异。我们的<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.05074">;分歧分析框架</a>;揭示了来自不同背景的评估者之间的各种分歧模式，包括“基本事实”专家评级。这为评估人类注释质量和模型评估的新方法铺平了道路，而不仅仅是简单地使用金标签。我们的 <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.11247">;NeurIPS 2023 出版物</a>;介绍了<a href="https://github.com/google-research-datasets/dices-dataset ">;DICES</a>;（对话式人工智能安全评估的多样性）数据集，有助于对法学硕士进行细致入微的安全评估，并考虑不同文化背景下的差异、模糊性和多样性。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;总结</h2>; <p>; GenAI带来了技术变革，为快速发展提供了可能性甚至无需编码即可进行定制。然而，它也存在产生有害输出的风险。我们的主动对抗性测试计划可识别并减轻 GenAI 风险，以确保包容性的模型行为。对抗性测试和红队是安全策略的重要组成部分，以全面的方式进行它们至关重要。创新的快速步伐要求我们不断挑战自我，与内部合作伙伴、多元化的用户社区和其他行业专家合作，寻找“未知的未知”。 </p>;</content>;<link href="http://blog.research.google/feeds/6928081948246813203/comments/default" rel="replies" title="发表评论" type="application/atom+xml "/>;<link href="http://blog.research.google/2023/11/responsible-ai-at-google-research_16.html#comment-form" rel="replies" title="0 条评论" 类型="text/html"/>;<link href="http://www.blogger.com/feeds/8474926331452026626/posts/default/6928081948246813203" rel="edit" type="application/atom+xml"/>;<链接 href="http://www.blogger.com/feeds/8474926331452026626/posts/default/6928081948246813203" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml"/>;<link href="http://blog .research.google/2023/11/responsible-ai-at-google-research_16.html" rel="alternate" title="Google Research 的负责任 AI：生成式 AI 安全的对抗性测试" type="text/html"/ >;<作者>;<名称>;Google AI</名称>;<uri>;http://www.blogger.com/profile/12098626514775266161</uri>;<电子邮件>;noreply@blogger.com</电子邮件>;<gd：图像高度=“16”rel =“http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail”src =“https://img1.blogblog.com/img/b16-rounded.gif”宽度=“16”>; </gd:image>;</author>;<media:thumbnail height="72" url="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEghkgEei5l04Gs6hz4cLk9IqdDbXcx-41xZsRsJ-b2WHLDng1eZzJqo9eAwBZjZHc5P2akAKxT6vQL bn0-5nxy_OuPA5QIyWAV9Yy_4iIGch-zM2W-88Y- 6e8HxkbG39hemnzheAx5GUvkMspUCaQiqE5RtxYvFKj-bI0pKzOhFVrWmSOgHJisYHBDfGdCl/s72-c/lockup_GoogleResearch_FullColor_Hero.jpg" width="72" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">;</media:thumbnail>;<thr:to总计>;0</ thr:total>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;标签：blogger.com,1999:blog-8474926331452026626.post-1338549955376716163</id>;<发布>;2023-11-14T12:28:00.000-08:00< /已发布>;<更新>;2023-11-14T14:09:51.250-08:00</更新>;<类别方案=“http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#”术语=“AI”>;< /category>;<category schema="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="计算机视觉">;</category>;<category schema="http://www.blogger.com/atom /ns#" term="多模式学习">;</category>;<category schema="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="视频分析">;</category>;<title type= "text">;将多模态理解扩展到长视频</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;发布者：Google 研究院软件工程师 Isaac Noble 和研究科学家 Anelia Angelova，谷歌 DeepMind </span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhS9q_iPaPNyYexT4zpSTnERwHJJGcmOemvRjjqD9sNPMwibC-iV5AU2P4J9VrPE_NGFyFz5QLxHpCti9Y-bOPEi9XPCev 5YwIpNKPMECDxk1prmksf99tPHgf1uQb7EW3zSmnIMWIFwAjvM7GldhsEtW7eogo1sG1L1nxD8UPIi0fpHR_Iwp8fJTdoUnQB/s1600/mirasol.png" style="显示：无；" />; <p>; 在为现实生活应用构建机器学习模型时，我们需要考虑多种模式的输入，以捕获我们周围世界的各个方面。例如，音频、视频和文本都提供有关视觉输入的各种补充信息。然而，由于模态的异质性，构建多模态模型具有挑战性。一些模式可能在时间上很好地同步（例如，音频、视频），但与文本不对齐。此外，视频和音频信号中的数据量比文本中的数据量大得多，因此当将它们组合成多模态模型时，视频和音频通常不能被充分消耗，并且需要不成比例地压缩。对于较长的视频输入，这个问题会更加严重。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 在“<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.05698">;Mirasol3B：一种多模态自回归模型，用于时间对齐和上下文模态</a>;”，我们引入了一种多模态<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autoregressive_model">;自回归</a>;模型（Mirasol3B），用于跨音频、视频和文本学习方式。主要思想是将多模态建模解耦为单独的聚焦自回归模型，根据模态的特征处理输入。我们的模型由一个用于时间同步模态（音频和视频）的自回归组件和一个单独的自回归组件组成，该自回归组件用于不一定是时间对齐但仍然是顺序的模态，例如文本输入，如标题或描述。此外，时间对齐的模态在时间上进行划分，可以共同学习局部特征。通过这种方式，音视频输入被及时建模，并且比以前的工作分配了相对更多的参数。与其他多模式模型相比，通过这种方法，我们可以轻松处理更长的视频（例如，128-512 帧）。在 3B 参数下，Mirasol3B 比之前的 <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2204.14198">;Flamingo</a>; (80B) 和 <a href="https://arxiv.org/ abs/2305.18565">;PaLI-X</a>; (55B) 型号。最后，Mirasol3B 在<a href="https://blog.research.google/2022/08/efficient-video-text-learning-with.html">;视频问答<方面优于最先进的方法< /a>;（视频 QA）、长视频 QA 和音频-视频-文本基准。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgshWPBWMbvzrYbGl-41QRmA5NWiQ4GKMb_nlTl-uKlY6D9TEKosZWbJk_wnllLqyq4GUQT6feI_rLH4rrYV oZHHQET750qT1pxkkiju6mWqG7ddCxLjgpywTb3rnQdDtaUTOeRvnZD0_a2mMauvs7vu6pzboeWcTCt_7bloNMDdZfNyM3Y_7UKcN-7VSqS/s1240/image5.gif “ imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="960" data-original-width="1240" src= “https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgshWPBWMbvzrYbGl-41QRmA5NWiQ4GKMb_nlTl-uKlY6D9TEKosZWbJk_wnllLqyq4GUQT6feI_rLH4rrYVoZHHQET750qT1pxkkiju6mW qG7ddCxLjgpywTb3rnQdDtaUTOeRvnZD0_a2mMauvs7vu6pzboeWcTCt_7bloNMDdZfNyM3Y_7UKcN-7VSqS/s16000/image5.gif"/>;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Mirasol3B 架构由一个用于时间对齐模态（音频和视频）的自回归模型（按块划分）和一个单独的自回归模型组成未对齐的上下文模式（例如文本）。联合特征学习由组合器进行，它学习紧凑但信息丰富的特征，允许处理长视频/音频输入。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line- height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;协调时间对齐和上下文模式</h2>; <p>; 视频、音频和文本是具有不同特征的多种模式。例如，视频是每秒 30-100 帧的时空视觉信号，但由于数据量较大，当前模型通常每个视频仅消耗 32-64 帧。音频是一种以比视频高得多的频率获得的一维时间信号（例如，16 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hertz">;Hz</a>;），而文本输入适用于整个视频的单词序列通常为 200-300 个单词序列，并用作音频-视频输入的上下文。为此，我们提出了一种模型，该模型由一个自回归组件和另一个自回归组件组成，该自回归组件融合并共同学习出现在高频且大致同步的时间对齐信号，以及另一个用于处理非对齐信号的自回归组件。时间对齐和上下文模式的组件之间的学习通过交叉注意机制进行协调，该机制允许两者在按顺序学习的同时交换信息，而无需及时同步它们。 </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;视频和音频的时间对齐自回归建模</h2>; <p>;长视频可以传达丰富的信息以及按顺序发生的活动。然而，当前的模型通过一次提取所有信息来进行视频建模，而没有足够的时间信息。为了解决这个问题，我们应用了一种自回归建模策略，在该策略中，我们根据先前时间间隔的特征表示来调节一个时间间隔内联合学习的视频和音频表示。这保留了时间信息。 </p>; <p>; 视频首先被分割成更小的视频块。每个块本身可以是 4-64 帧。然后，与每个块相对应的特征由称为组合器（如下所述）的学习模块进行处理，该模块在当前步骤中生成联合音频和视频特征表示——此步骤提取并压缩每个块最重要的信息。接下来，我们使用自回归 Transformer 处理这个联合特征表示，它将注意力集中到之前的特征表示上，并生成下一步的联合特征表示。因此，模型不仅学习如何表示每个单独的块，还学习如何表示块在时间上的关联。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh90Ao2yyoC5TSypNxQzA7F80lQla0f4STDrB6ZdVhINwiiQjOq1WppROFurlUn9-Lq_UUQ9uuQIeRDld-j2NMYl1 e5q2Cg2L0zOHXSG0dAkpCSqVe-wEyE8QZtUup7AUazE3sBEyoO2T3RhWSc5Z7o1w0pyqMH0WzTts3vaxUnMNOa61uWXvQ2Wj92evO5/s1259/image1.png “ imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="744" data-original-width="1259" src= “https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh90Ao2yyoC5TSypNxQzA7F80lQla0f4STDrB6ZdVhINwiiQjOq1WppROFurlUn9-Lq_UUQ9uuQIeRDld-j2NMYl1e5q2Cg2L0zOHXSG0dAkp CSqVe-wEyE8QZtUup7AUazE3sBEyoO2T3RhWSc5Z7o1w0pyqMH0WzTts3vaxUnMNOa61uWXvQ2Wj92evO5/s16000/image1.png"/>;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;我们对音频和视频输入使用自回归建模，按时间对它们进行分区并学习联合特征表示，然后按顺序自回归学习。</ td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;使用模态组合器对长视频进行建模</h2>; <为了组合每个视频块中视频和音频信息的信号，我们提出了一个称为组合器的学习模块。通过获取与特定视频时间帧相对应的音频输入来对齐视频和音频信号。然后，我们在时空上处理视频和音频输入，提取与输入变化特别相关的信息（对于我们使用的视频<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.03229">;稀疏视频管</a>;，对于音频，我们应用<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spectrogram">;频谱图</a>;表示，两者均由<a处理href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2010.11929">;视觉转换器）</a>;。我们将这些特征连接并输入到组合器中，组合器旨在学习捕获这两个输入的新特征表示。为了解决视频和音频信号中大量数据的挑战，组合器的另一个目标是降低联合视频/音频输入的维度，这是通过选择较少数量的要生成的输出特征来完成的。组合器可以简单地实现为因果变压器，它在时间方向上处理输入，即仅使用先前步骤或当前步骤的输入。或者，组合器可以具有可学习存储器，如下所述。 </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Combiner 样式</h2>; <p>; Combiner 的简单版本采用了 Transformer 架构。更具体地说，来自当前块（以及可选的先前块）的所有音频和视频特征被输入到变换器并投影到较低维度，即，选择较少数量的特征作为输出“组合”特征。虽然 Transformer 通常不会在这种情况下使用，但我们发现通过选择 Transformer 的最后 <em>;m</em>; 个输出（如果 <em>;m</em>; 是），可以有效地降低输入特征的维度。所需的输出尺寸（如下所示）。或者，组合器可以具有存储器组件。例如，我们使用<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.09119">;令牌图灵机</a>;（TTM），它支持可微分的内存单元，累积和压缩所有先前时间步长的特征。使用固定内存允许模型在每一步处理更紧凑的特征集，而不是处理先前步骤的所有特征，从而减少计算量。 </p>; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="619" data-original-width="1798" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh0C7t17njiE70O5UrLHjfEHAw5dbAlNvYj7bMxQt_GkxNUdGtnqKyAwpWi7uvE_IGiS-50Q2Qyo4CAzq8uZbkXZ-HzNh-DCh6UNSSIwxUlWSOtihmChwFXD4F3LS73C_1fusf5fQl7TyTQv2L5ycmfSCj36GK3IrN4yaOAjODj09NBmcAMJzV0TZS_0qNI/s16000/image8.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;We use a simple Transformer-based Combiner (<b>;left</b>;) and a Memory Combiner (<b>;right</b>;), based on the Token Turing Machine (TTM), which uses memory to compress previous history of features.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Results</h2>; <p>; We evaluate our approach on several benchmarks, <a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/cvpr16.msr-vtt.tmei_-1.pdf">;MSRVTT-QA</a>;, <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.02467">;ActivityNet-QA</a>; and <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2105.08276">;NeXT-QA</a>;, for the video QA task, where a text-based question about a video is issued and the model needs to answer. This evaluates the ability of the model to understand both the text-based question and video content, and to form an answer, focusing on only relevant information. Of these benchmarks, the latter two target long video inputs and feature more complex questions. </p>; <p>; We also evaluate our approach in the more challenging open-ended text generation setting, wherein the model generates the answers in an unconstrained fashion as free form text, requiring an exact match to the ground truth answer. While this stricter evaluation counts synonyms as incorrect, it may better reflect a model's ability to generalize. </p>; <p>; Our results indicate improved performance over state-of-the-art approaches for most benchmarks, including all with open-ended generation evaluation — notable considering our model is only 3B parameters, considerably smaller than prior approaches, eg, Flamingo 80B. We used only video and text inputs to be comparable to other work. Importantly, our model can process 512 frames without needing to increase the model parameters, which is crucial for handling longer videos. Finally with the TTM Combiner, we see both better or comparable performance while reducing compute by 18%. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; and <a href="https://epic-kitchens.github.io/epic-sounds/">;EPIC-SOUNDS</a>; are shown below. Since these benchmarks are classification-only, we treat them as an open-ended text generative setting where our model produces the text of the desired class; eg, for the class ID corresponding to the “playing drums” activity, we expect the model to generate the text “playing drums”. In some cases our approach outperforms the prior state of the art by large margins, even though our model outputs the results in the generative open-ended setting. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; We also compare the effects of pre-training. Because standard methods are ill-suited for processing longer video, this experiment is conducted for 32 frames and four chunks only, across all settings for fair comparison. We see that Mirasol3B's improvements are still valid for relatively short videos. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgjD4KZfUgaGluUNoSERSnuaHWMsbyx6AzHrgKrvDB1ZJxpOqNonvOzTI4hGVz4I8KZQT4aDLkQ6rvMjQIHJCY9otQIZHuSeoNK1ciQ2ALE3n1zYzQEvPdwUR_81uEDeD5U9DXDABK8ozbONAHkK0hZFMHS0j6IoumYfmjKI-M9ZHb76F2kHl-6XTPEn2eG/s1200/image4.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="742" data-original-width="1200" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgjD4KZfUgaGluUNoSERSnuaHWMsbyx6AzHrgKrvDB1ZJxpOqNonvOzTI4hGVz4I8KZQT4aDLkQ6rvMjQIHJCY9otQIZHuSeoNK1ciQ2ALE3n1zYzQEvPdwUR_81uEDeD5U9DXDABK8ozbONAHkK0hZFMHS0j6IoumYfmjKI-M9ZHb76F2kHl-6XTPEn2eG/s16000/image4.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Ablation experiments comparing the main components of our model. Using the Combiner, the autoregressive modeling, and pre-training all improve performance.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Conclusion </h2>; <p>; We present a multimodal autoregressive model that addresses the challenges associated with the heterogeneity of multimodal data by coordinating the learning between time-aligned and time-unaligned modalities. Time-aligned modalities are further processed autoregressively in time with a Combiner, controlling the sequence length and producing powerful representations. We demonstrate that a relatively small model can successfully represent long video and effectively combine with other modalities. We outperform the state-of-the-art approaches (including some much bigger models) on video- and audio-video question answering. </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Acknowledgements</h2>; <p>; <em>;This research is co-authored by AJ Piergiovanni, Isaac Noble, Dahun Kim, Michael Ryoo, Victor Gomes, and Anelia Angelova. style="display: none;" />; <p>; As consumer technologies like <a href="https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/healthcare-life-sciences/google-cloud-fitbit-haga-collaborate-on-pilot-heart-study">;fitness trackers</a>; and <a href="https://blog.google/products/pixel/health-ai-better-sleep/">;mobile phones</a>; become more widely used for health-related data collection, so does the opportunity to leverage these data pathways to study and advance our understanding of medical conditions. We have <a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/11/responsible-ai-at-google-research.html">;previously</a>; touched upon how our work explores the use of this technology within the context of chronic diseases, in particular multiple sclerosis (MS). This effort leverages the <a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies">;FDA MyStudies platform</a>;, an open-source platform used to create clinical study apps, that makes it easier for anyone to run their own studies and collect good quality healthcare data, in a trusted and safe way. </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; Today, we describe the setup that we developed by expanding the FDA MyStudies platform and demonstrate how it can be used to set up a digital health study. We also present our exploratory research study created through this platform, called MS Signals, which consists of a symptom tracking app for MS patients. The goal for this app is twofold: 1) to ensure that the enhancements to the FDA MyStudies platform made for a more streamlined study creation experience; and 2) to understand how new data collection mechanisms can be used to revolutionize patients' chronic disease management and tracking. We have <a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies-flutter">;open sourced</a>; our extension to the FDA MyStudies platform under the <a href="https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0">;Apache 2.0 license</a>; to provide a resource for the community to build their own studies. </p>; <br />; <h2>;Extending the FDA MyStudies platform</h2>; <p>; The original FDA MyStudies platform allowed people to configure their own study apps, manage participants, and create separate iOS and Android apps. To simplify the study creation process and ensure increased study engagement, we made a number of accessibility changes. Some of the main improvements include: cross-platform (iOS and Android) app generation through the use of <a href="https://flutter.dev/">;Flutter</a>;, an open source framework by Google for building multi-platform applications from a single codebase; a simplified setup, so that users can prototype their study quickly (under a day in most cases); and, most importantly, an emphasis on accessibility so that diverse patient's voices are heard. The accessibility enhancements include changes to the underlying features of the platform and to the particular study design of the MS Signals study app. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;Multi-platform support with rapid prototyping</h3>; <p>; We decided on the use of Flutter as it would be a single point that would generate both iOS and Android apps in one go, reducing the work required to support multiple platforms. Flutter also provides <a href="https://docs.flutter.dev/tools/hot-reload">;hot-reloading</a>;, which allows developers to build & preview features quickly. The design-system in the app takes advantage of this feature to provide a central point from which the branding & theme of the app can be changed to match the tone of a new study and previewed instantly. The demo environment in the app also utilizes this feature to allow developers to mock and preview questionnaires locally on their machines. In our experience this has been a huge time-saver in A/B testing the UX and the format and wording of questions live with clinicians. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;System accessibility enhancements</h3>; <p>; To improve the accessibility of the platform for more users, we made several usability enhancements: </p>; <ol>; <li>;Light & dark theme support</li>; <li>;Bold text & variable font-sizes</li>; <li>;High-contrast mode</li>; <li>;Improving user awareness of accessibility settings</li>; </ol>; <p>; Extended exposure to bright light themes can strain the eyes, so supporting dark theme features was necessary to make it easier to use the study app frequently. Some small or light text-elements are illegible to users with vision impairments, so we added 1) bold-text and support for larger font-sizes and 2) high-contrast color-schemes. To ensure that accessibility settings are easy to find, we placed an introductory one-time screen that was presented during the app's first launch, which would directly take users to their system accessibility settings. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;Study accessibility enhancements</h3>; <p>; To make the study itself easier to interact with and reduce cognitive overload, we made the following changes: </p>; <ol>; <li>;Clarified the onboarding process</li>; <li>;Improved design for questionnaires</li>; </ol>; <p>; First, we clarified the on-boarding process by presenting users with a list of required steps when they first open the app in order to reduce confusion and participant drop-off. </p>; <p>; The original questionnaire design in the app presented each question in a card format, which utilizes part of the screen for shadows and depth effects of the card. In many situations, this is a pleasant aesthetic, but in apps where accessibility is priority, these visual elements restrict the space available on the screen. Thus, when more accessible, larger font-sizes are used there are more frequent word breaks, which reduces readability. We fixed this simply by removing the card design elements and instead using the entire screen, allowing for better visuals with larger font-sizes. </p>; <br />; <h2>;The MS Signals prototype study</h2>; <p>; To test the usability of these changes, we used our redesigned platform to create a prototype study app called MS Signals, which uses surveys to gather information about a participant's MS-related symptoms. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;MS Studies app design</h3>; <p>; As a first step, before entering any study information, participants are asked to complete an eligibility and study comprehension questionnaire to ensure that they have read through the potentially lengthy terms of study participation. This might include, for example, questions like "In what country is the study available?" or “Can you withdraw from the study?" A section like this is common in most health studies, and it tends to be the first drop-off point for participants. </p>; <p>; To minimize study drop-off at this early stage, we kept the eligibility test brief and reflected correct answers for the comprehension test back to the participants. This helps minimize the number of times a user may need to go through the initial eligibility questionnaire and ensures that the important aspects of the study protocol are made clear to them. </p>; <p>; After successful enrollment, participants are taken to the main app view, which consists of three pages: </p>; <ul>; <li>;<strong>;Activities:</strong>; <br />; This page lists the questionnaires available to the participant and is where the majority of their time is spent. The questionnaires vary in frequency — some are one-time surveys created to gather medical history, while others are repeated daily, weekly or monthly, depending on the symptom or area they are exploring. For the one-time survey we provide a counter above each question to signal to users how far they have come and how many questions are left, similar to the questionnaire during the eligibility and comprehension step. </li>; <li>;<strong>;Dashboard:</strong>; <br />; To ensure that participants get something back in return for the information they enter during a study, the Dashboard area presents a summary of their responses in graph or pie chart form. Participants could potentially show this data to their care provider as a summary of their condition over the last 6 months, an improvement over the traditional pen and paper methods that many employ today. </li>; <li>;<strong>;Resources:</strong>; <br />; A set of useful links, help articles and common questions related to MS. </li>; </ul>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;Questionnaire design</h3>; <p>; Since needing to frequently input data can lead to cognitive overload, participant drop off, and bad data quality, we reduced the burden in two ways: </p>; <ol>; <li>;We break down large questionnaires into smaller ones, resulting in 6 daily surveys, containing 3–5 questions each, where each question is multiple choice and related to a single symptom. This way we cover a total of 20 major symptoms, and present them in a similar way to how a clinician would ask these questions in an in-clinic setting.</li>; <li>;We ensure previously entered information is readily available in the app, along with the time of the entry.</li>; </ol>; <p>; In designing the survey content, we collaborated closely with experienced clinicians and researchers to finalize the wording and layout. While studies in this field typically use the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Likert_scale">;Likert scale</a>; to gather symptom information, we defined a more intuitive verbose scale to provide better experience for participants tracking their disease and the clinicians or researchers viewing the disease history. For example, in the case of vision issues, rather than asking participants to rate their symptoms on a scale from 1 to 10, we instead present a multiple choice question where we detail common vision problems that they may be experiencing. </p>; <p>; This verbose scale helps patients track their symptoms more accurately by including context that helps them more clearly define their symptoms. This approach also allows researchers to answer questions that go beyond symptom correlation. For example, for vision issues, data collected using the verbose scale would reveal to researchers whether <a href="https://www.webmd.com/eye-health/nystagmus">;nystagmus</a>; is more prominent in patients with MS compared to double vision. </p>; <h2>;Focusing on accessibility</h2>; <p>; Mobile-based studies can often present additional challenges for participants with chronic conditions: the text can be hard to read, the color contrast could make it difficult to see certain bits of information, or it may be challenging to scroll through pages. This may result in participant drop off, which, in turn, could yield a biased dataset if the people who are experiencing more advanced forms of a disease are unable to provide data. </p>; <p>; In order to prevent such issues, we include the following accessibility features: </p>; <ul>; <li>;Throughout, we employ color blind accessible color schemes. This includes improving the contrast between crucial text and important additional information, which might otherwise be presented in a smaller font and a faded text color.</li>; <li>;We reduced the amount of movement required to access crucial controls by placing all buttons close to the bottom of the page and ensuring that pop-ups are controllable from the bottom part of the screen.</li>; </ul>; <p>; To test the accessibility of MS Signals, we collaborated with the <a href="https://www.nationalmssociety.org/">;National MS Society</a>; to recruit participants for a user experience study. For this, a call for participation was sent out by the Society to their members, and 9 respondents were asked to test out the various app flows. The majority indicated that they would like a better way than their current method to track their symptom data, that they considered MS Signals to be a unique and valuable tool that would enhance the accuracy of their symptom tracking, and that they would want to share the dashboard view with their healthcare providers. </p>; <br />; <h2>;Next steps</h2>; <p>; We want to encourage everyone to make use of the <a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies-flutter">;open source</a>; platform to start setting up and running their own studies. We are working on creating a set of standard study templates, which would incorporate what we learned from above, and we hope to release those soon. For any issues, comments or questions please check out our <a href="https://goo.gle/ms-signals">;resource page</a>;. </p>;</content>;<link Katherine Heller, Research Scientist, Google Research, on behalf of the CAIR Team</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjN3mIK7184k0E4B4Pddafelrcf4yEqd1wTOxyK5LZlxKL8dFWwbEyATjS0Zbj8HBdAnIXQ40fVedg4O5oUi5_fVvOvKRQWhgIX05olZkb9YakVdRLXus3b9Pzze5oHu32X0VUpoykEvGwbZk9W2lEIJ8jUMlgzyML0yFFsyBbpbAUZgBk6TSli7bRaNQRs/s1100/CAIR-hero.jpg" style="display: none;" />; <p>; Artificial intelligence (AI) and related machine learning (ML) technologies are increasingly influential in the world around us, making it imperative that we consider the potential impacts on society and individuals in all aspects of the technology that we create. To these ends, the Context in AI Research (CAIR) team develops novel AI methods in the context of the entire AI pipeline:<strong>; </strong>;from data to end-user feedback. The pipeline for building an AI system typically starts with <em>;data</em>; collection, followed by designing a <em>;model</em>; to run on that data, <em>;deployment</em>; of the model in the real world, and lastly, compiling and incorporation of <em>;human feedback</em>;. Originating in the health space, and now expanded to additional areas, the work of the CAIR team impacts every aspect of this pipeline. While specializing in model building, we have a particular focus on building systems with responsibility in mind, including fairness, robustness, transparency, and inclusion. </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEidxBmC-Vmh8A8AdqFMHkEIqz5pcp85_vX6uPteEiaF00boHGuUo3M45rtunHL58dOillPI_7Vn3BwxavTGbmPpWcUQorJsjY6x5gh8agM9jbPio8c29iFvYUgVhO1BkEsU5eg133JKfLkcQHN3FteCyeorkzS79e0u7TDig_xCv_B_36UYLfK7gx2pgtQK/s1050/CAIR.png" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="383" data-original-width="1050" height="234" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEidxBmC-Vmh8A8AdqFMHkEIqz5pcp85_vX6uPteEiaF00boHGuUo3M45rtunHL58dOillPI_7Vn3BwxavTGbmPpWcUQorJsjY6x5gh8agM9jbPio8c29iFvYUgVhO1BkEsU5eg133JKfLkcQHN3FteCyeorkzS79e0u7TDig_xCv_B_36UYLfK7gx2pgtQK/w640-h234/CAIR.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <h2>;Data </h2>; <p>; The CAIR team focuses on understanding the data on which ML systems are built. Improving the standards for the transparency of ML datasets is instrumental in our work. First, we employ documentation frameworks to elucidate dataset and model characteristics as guidance in the development of data and model documentation techniques — <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1803.09010">;Datasheets for Datasets</a>; and <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1810.03993">;Model Cards for Model Reporting</a>;. </p>; <p>; For example, health datasets are highly sensitive and yet can have high impact. For this reason, we developed <a href="https://dl.acm.org/doi/fullHtml/10.1145/3531146.3533239">;Healthsheets</a>;, a health-contextualized adaptation of a Datasheet. Our motivation for developing a health-specific sheet lies in the limitations of existing regulatory frameworks for AI and health. <a href="https://www.nejm.org/doi/10.1056/NEJMp1816373">;Recent research</a>; suggests that data privacy regulation and standards (eg, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Health_Insurance_Portability_and_Accountability_Act">;HIPAA</a>;, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Data_Protection_Regulation">;GDPR</a>;, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California_Consumer_Privacy_Act">;California Consumer Privacy Act</a>;) do not ensure ethical collection, documentation, and use of data. Healthsheets aim to fill this gap in ethical dataset analysis. The development of Healthsheets was done in collaboration with many stakeholders in relevant job roles, including clinical, legal and regulatory, bioethics, privacy, and product. </p>; <p>; Further, we studied how Datasheets and Healthsheets could serve as diagnostic tools that surface the limitations and strengths of datasets. Our aim was to start a conversation in the community and tailor Healthsheets to dynamic healthcare scenarios over time. </p>; <p>; To facilitate this effort, we joined the <a href="http://www.datadiversity.org/">;STANDING Together</a>; initiative, a consortium that aims to develop <a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41591-022-01987-w">;international, consensus-based standards for documentation of diversity and representation</a>; within health datasets and to provide guidance on how to mitigate risk of bias translating to harm and health inequalities. Being part of this international, interdisciplinary partnership that spans academic, clinical, regulatory, policy, industry, patient, and charitable organizations worldwide enables us to engage in the conversation about responsibility in AI for healthcare internationally. Over 250 stakeholders from across 32 countries have contributed to refining the standards<strong>;.</strong>; </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjUogIg5rJu-5i259KxpG9DrCD7an9L1KTpugqjw__6LWGUIF-78hkPUpjbUWc8SAZ7BZk82RlI7ddaW3Fe9spfn-hbyNLk94LAFWb3XvynnbLJddwxv8sSd0swacF5_C6UV2NjM0FXzLWKiYDnW3F_SjyOvUVp0BO2YADXBqbabbUP5D7X1i5czhqfrOcw/s1050/Healthsheets.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="731" data-original-width="1050" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjUogIg5rJu-5i259KxpG9DrCD7an9L1KTpugqjw__6LWGUIF-78hkPUpjbUWc8SAZ7BZk82RlI7ddaW3Fe9spfn-hbyNLk94LAFWb3XvynnbLJddwxv8sSd0swacF5_C6UV2NjM0FXzLWKiYDnW3F_SjyOvUVp0BO2YADXBqbabbUP5D7X1i5czhqfrOcw/s16000/Healthsheets.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;<em style="text-align: left;">;Healthsheets and STANDING Together: towards health data documentation and standards.</em>;</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <h2>;Model</h2>; <p>; When ML systems are deployed in the real world, they may fail to behave in expected ways, making poor predictions in new contexts. Such failures can occur for a myriad of reasons and can carry negative consequences, especially within the context of healthcare. Our work aims to identify situations where unexpected model behavior may be discovered, before it becomes a substantial problem, and to mitigate the unexpected and undesired consequences. </p>; <p>; Much of the CAIR team's modeling work focuses on identifying and mitigating when models are <a href="https://blog.research.google/2021/10/how-underspecification-presents.html">;underspecified</a>;. We show that models that perform well on held-out data drawn from a training domain are not equally robust or fair under distribution shift because the models vary in the extent to which they rely on spurious correlations. This poses a risk to users and practitioners because it can be difficult to anticipate model instability using standard model evaluation practices. <a href="https://www.jmlr.org/papers/v23/20-1335.html">;We have demonstrated</a>; that this concern arises in several domains, including computer vision, natural language processing, medical imaging, and prediction from electronic health records. </p>; <p>; We have also shown how to use knowledge of causal mechanisms to diagnose and mitigate fairness and robustness issues in new contexts. Knowledge of causal structure allows practitioners to anticipate <a href="https://proceedings.neurips.cc/paper_files/paper/2022/hash/7a969c30dc7e74d4e891c8ffb217cf79-Abstract-Conference.html">;the generalizability of fairness properties under distribution shift in real-world medical settings</a>;. Further, investigating the capability for specific causal pathways, or “shortcuts”, to introduce bias in ML systems, we demonstrate how to identify cases where <a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-023-39902-7">;shortcut learning</a>; leads to predictions in ML systems that are unintentionally dependent on sensitive attributes (eg, age, sex, race). We have shown how to use causal <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Directed_acyclic_graph">;directed acyclic graphs</a>; to <a href="https://proceedings.mlr.press/v206/alabdulmohsin23a">;adapt ML systems to changing environments</a>; under complex forms of distribution shift. Our team is currently investigating how a causal interpretation of different forms of bias, including <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Selection_bias">;selection bias</a>;, label bias, and measurement error, <a href="https://nips.cc/virtual/2022/58452">;motivates the design of techniques to mitigate bias during model development and evaluation</a>;. </p>; <br />; <p>; The CAIR team focuses on developing methodology to build more inclusive models broadly. For example, we also have <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.03874">;work on the design of participatory systems</a>;, which allows individuals to choose whether to disclose sensitive attributes, such as race, when an ML system makes predictions. We hope that our methodological research positively impacts the societal understanding of inclusivity in AI method development. </p>; <br />; <h2>;Deployment </h2>; <p>; The CAIR team aims to build technology that improves the lives of all people through the use of mobile device technology. We aim to reduce suffering from health conditions, address systemic inequality, and enable transparent device-based data collection. As consumer technology, such as fitness trackers and mobile phones, become central in data collection for health, we explored the use of these technologies within the context of chronic disease, in particular, for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multiple_sclerosis">;multiple sclerosis</a>; (MS). We developed new data collection mechanisms and predictions that we hope will eventually revolutionize patient's chronic disease management, clinical trials, medical reversals and drug development. </p>; <p>; First, we extended the open-source <a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies">;FDA MyStudies platform</a>;, which is used to create clinical study apps, to make it easier for anyone to run their own studies and collect good quality data, in a trusted and safe way. Our improvements include zero-config setups, so that researchers can prototype their study in a day, cross-platform app generation through the use of <a href="https://flutter.dev/">;Flutter</a>; and, most importantly, an emphasis on accessibility so that all patient's voices are heard. We are excited to announce this work has now been <a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies-flutter">;open sourced</a>; as an extension to the original FDA-Mystudies platform. You can start setting up your own studies today! </p>; <p>; To test this platform, we built a prototype app, which we call MS Signals, that uses surveys to interface with patients in a novel consumer setting. We collaborated with the <a href="https://www.nationalmssociety.org/">;National MS Society</a>; to recruit participants for a user experience study for the app, with the goal of reducing dropout rates and improving the platform further. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjmHAb0ppbGGoplKXFyrazbLPjXWf9FKDKwOh0yfiuiTkq_kVQsme9ckeS6mnSXWkfitNJKmtMvnUm0b39xr7cvGHs_oZx9mEYAf7wlwdghFSbVqvmV8MDw4TVLontCm-zT6KhUf0kEsQ3RoroWJWv0D2z29P4_vcaby4Udx6ENdaCXx9kep73iQ5HoufCq/s915/MSSignals.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="904" data-original-width="915" height="632" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjmHAb0ppbGGoplKXFyrazbLPjXWf9FKDKwOh0yfiuiTkq_kVQsme9ckeS6mnSXWkfitNJKmtMvnUm0b39xr7cvGHs_oZx9mEYAf7wlwdghFSbVqvmV8MDw4TVLontCm-zT6KhUf0kEsQ3RoroWJWv0D2z29P4_vcaby4Udx6ENdaCXx9kep73iQ5HoufCq/w640-h632/MSSignals.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;<em style="text-align: left;">;MS Signals app screenshots. <strong>;Left:</strong>; Study welcome screen. <strong>;Right:</strong>; Questionnaire.</em>;</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <p>; Once data is collected, researchers could potentially use it to drive the frontier of ML research in MS. In a separate study, we established a research collaboration with the <a href="https://neurology.duke.edu/">;Duke Department of Neurology</a>; and demonstrated that ML models can <a href="https://www.researchsquare.com/article/rs-2547289/v1">;accurately predict the incidence of high-severity symptoms</a>; within three months using continuously collected data from mobile apps. Results suggest that the trained models can be used by clinicians to evaluate the symptom trajectory of MS participants, which may inform decision making for administering interventions. </p>; <p>; The CAIR team has been involved in the deployment of many other systems, for both internal and external use. For example, we have also partnered with <a href="https://learningally.org/">;Learning Ally</a>; to <a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2023/08/study-socially-aware-temporally-causal.html">;build a book recommendation system</a>; for children with learning disabilities, such as dyslexia. We hope that our work positively impacts future product development. </p>; <br />; <h2>;Human feedback </h2>; <p>; As ML models become ubiquitous throughout the developed world, it can be far too easy to leave voices in less developed countries behind. A priority of the CAIR team is to bridge this gap, develop deep relationships with communities, and work together to address ML-related concerns through community-driven approaches. </p>; <p>; One of the ways we are doing this is through working with grassroots organizations for ML, such as <a href="https://www.sisonkebiotik.africa/home">;Sisonkebiotik</a>;, an open and inclusive community of researchers, practitioners and enthusiasts at the intersection of ML and healthcare working together to build capacity and drive forward research initiatives in Africa. We worked in collaboration with the Sisonkebiotik community to detail limitations of historical top-down approaches for global health, and suggested complementary health-based methods, specifically type="html">; <span class="byline-author">;发布者：量子 AI 团队研究科学家 Kevin Miao 和 Matt McEwen</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEidYny_9v0IyOBy7QbYVgwS5FAHzgHhVUt5FQvjXhi6WWJHyIIal3awBfaXNu9l3 g47HElKNkFNf6XfpU7a_9ExGLlKFgOWvUOaT0PLhEoCfofJrazqT2IL1fBMtZMwfGJSnrpBrQZwQkYJOV6iMOmhWBWIH5OCPcsEPkgw -LuiPDBoLYToGGIN3Hjfpmwr/s320/Quantum%20leakage.jpg" style="显示：无；" />; <p>; 组成<a href="https://quantumai.google/hardware">;的<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qubit">;量子位</a>;谷歌量子设备</a>;非常脆弱且嘈杂，因此在构建有用的量子计算机的过程中，有必要采用纠错程序来识别和解释量子位错误。两种最常见的错误机制是<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_error_ Correction#Bit_flip_code">;位翻转错误</a>;（量子位的能量状态发生变化）和< a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_error_ Correction#Sign_flip_code">;相位翻转错误</a>;（编码的量子信息的相位发生变化）。 <a href="https://blog.research.google/2021/08/demonstrating-fundamentals-of-quantum.html">;量子纠错</a>; (QEC) 有望解决和减轻这两个突出的错误。然而，还有各种各样的其他错误机制挑战了 QEC 的有效性。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 虽然我们希望量子位表现得理想<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two-state_quantum_system">;两个级系统</a>;没有损失机制，但现实情况并非如此。我们使用量子位的最低两个能级（构成<em>;计算基础</em>;）来进行计算。这两个级别对应于量子位中激发的不存在（计算基态）或存在（计算激发态），并标记为 |0⟩ （“<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki /Bra%E2%80%93ket_notation">;ket</a>; 零”）和 |1⟩（“ket 1”）。然而，我们的量子位还存在许多称为“泄漏状态”的更高级别，这些级别可能会被占用。按照通过指示量子位中有多少激发来标记能级的约定，我们将它们指定为 |2⟩、|3⟩、|4⟩ 等。 </p>; <p>; 在“<a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41567-023-02226-w">;克服量子纠错中的泄漏</a>;”中，发表于 < em>;<a href="https://www.nature.com/nphys/">;自然物理学</a>;</em>;，我们确定了我们的量子位何时以及如何将能量泄漏到更高的状态，并表明泄漏的能量状态可以通过我们的两个量子位门破坏附近的量子位。然后，我们确定并实施一种策略，可以消除泄漏并将其转换为 QEC 可以有效修复的错误。最后，我们表明这些操作可以显着提高 QEC 过程的性能和稳定性。最后一个结果尤其重要，因为额外的操作需要时间，通常会导致更多错误。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;使用不完美的量子位</h2>; <p>;我们的量子处理器是由称为<的超导量子位构建的em>;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transmon">;transmons</a>;</em>;。与只有两个计算能级（计算基态和计算激发态）的理想量子位不同，跨量子位具有许多比计算激发态能量更高的附加状态。这些较高的泄漏态对于生成<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_entanglement">;纠缠</a>;（量子算法中的必要资源）的特定操作非常有用，并且还可以防止跨子变成过于非线性且难以操作。然而，Transmon 也可能通过各种过程无意中被激发到这些泄漏状态，包括我们用于执行操作的控制脉冲的缺陷或低温冰箱中残留的少量杂散热。这些过程统称为<em>;泄漏</em>;，它描述了量子位从计算状态到泄漏状态的转变。 </p>; <p>; 考虑在我们的 QEC 实验中广泛使用的特定双量子位运算：<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_quantum_logic_gates#Clifford_qubit_gates:~:text=% 5B1%5D-,受控%2DZ,-%2C%0A受控%20sign">;CZ 门</a>;。该门在两个量子位上运行，当两个量子位都处于 |1⟩ 水平时，相互作用会导致两个单独的激励在其中一个量子位中短暂“聚集”在一起，形成 |2⟩，而另一个量子位则变为 |0 ⟩，然后返回到每个量子位位于 |1⟩ 的原始配置。这种聚集是 CZ 门纠缠能力的基础。然而，门可能会遇到错误，并且激励不会返回到其原始配置，从而导致操作将量子位留在|2⟩（泄漏状态）中，这种可能性很小。当我们执行数百个或更多的 CZ 门时，这种小的泄漏错误概率就会累积。 </p>; Y61fOtmsgl5pbeKIZCOLcWr4_4bQjZoBHz4zPNkBelyF-ZW0aUJDBpIQdamwg7VYWZxeCNk0q57L/w400-h400/image1.png" width="400" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr >;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Transmon 量子位支持许多超出计算基础 (|0⟩) 的泄漏状态 (|2⟩、|3⟩、|4⟩、…)和|1⟩）。虽然我们通常只使用计算基础来表示量子信息，但有时量子位会进入这些泄漏状态，并扰乱量子位的正常运行。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <p>; 单个泄漏事件对正常的量子位操作尤其有害，因为它会引起许多单独的错误。当一个量子位以泄漏状态开始时，CZ 门不再正确地纠缠量子位，从而阻止算法正确执行。不仅如此，应用于泄漏状态的一个量子位的 CZ 门也会导致另一量子位泄漏，从而将泄漏传播到整个设备。我们的工作包括广泛表征泄漏是如何引起的以及它如何与我们在量子处理器中使用的各种操作相互作用。 </p>; <p>; 一旦量子位进入泄漏状态，它就可以在许多操作中保持该状态，然后再恢复到计算状态。这意味着单个泄漏事件会干扰该量子位上的许多操作，从而产生及时聚集在一起的操作错误（<em>;时间相关</em>;错误）。泄漏通过 CZ 门在我们设备中的不同量子位之间传播的能力意味着我们还会同时看到相邻量子位上的大量错误（<em>;空间相关</em>;错误）。事实上，泄漏会导致空间和时间相关的错误模式，因此从 QEC 算法的角度来看，诊断和纠正尤其困难。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;QEC 中泄漏的影响</h2>; <p>; 我们的目标是通过实施来减轻量子位错误<a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/02/suppressing-quantum-errors-by-scaling.html">;表面代码 QEC</a>;，一组应用于不完美集合的操作物理量子位形成逻辑量子位，其属性更接近理想量子位。简而言之，我们使用一组称为数据量子位的量子位来保存量子信息，而另一组测量量子位检查数据量子位，报告它们是否遭受了任何错误，但没有破坏数据量子位的微妙量子态。 QEC 的关键基本假设之一是每个操作都独立发生错误，但泄漏可能会持续存在于许多操作中并导致多个错误的相关模式。当泄漏导致违反这一假设时，我们的 QEC 策略的性能会受到显着限制。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgUgCL-XuUZldvjck8dvEO5-9ei_Oq0m4kihQ5rHgGr66ggLVjJ3XZDuNl7Tw3s6EePJ-5NTL42-0UCpNuUoC2 -15jJ6uX2aPCULu-KISQJEiCYKfe3HR55vWCr3oDxmKu5g -WzBDS3jM-tuGSnxOHFb8kM4shNqKGPqGtKzs8FFRCPs-hH8mjsvkKLrNza/s1588/image3.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="880" data-original-宽度=“1588”src=“https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgUgCL-XuUZldvjck8dvEO5-9ei_Oq0m4kihQ5rHgGr66ggLVjJ3XZDuNl7Tw3s6EePJ-5NTL42-0UCpNuUoC2-15jJ6uX 2aPCULu-KISQJEiCYKfe3HR55vWCr3oDxmKu5g-WzBDS3jM-tuGSnxOHFb8kM4shNqKGPqGtKzs8FFRCPs-hH8mjsvkKLrNza/s16000/image3.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;一旦泄漏出现在我们的表面代码 transmon 网格中，它就会持续存在相对于单个表面代码QEC周期来说较长的时间。更糟糕的是，一个量子位上的泄漏也会导致其邻居泄漏。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <p>; 我们的 <a href="https:/ /blog.research.google/2021/08/demonstrating-fundamentals-of-quantum.html#:~:text=the%20Sycamore%20device.-,Leaky%20Qubits,-The%20goal%20of">;之前的工作</ a>; 表明，我们可以使用称为“多级重置”(MLR) 的操作消除测量量子位中的泄漏。这是可能的，因为一旦我们对测量量子位进行测量，它们就不再保存任何重要的量子信息。此时，我们可以将量子位与一个非常有损耗的频带进行交互，从而导致量子位所处的任何状态（包括泄漏状态）衰减到计算基态 |0⟩。如果我们想象一个代表量子位中的激发的<em>;Jenga</em>;塔，我们就会把整个堆栈翻倒。然而，仅拆除一块砖就更具挑战性。同样，MLR 不适用于数据量子位，因为它们<em>;总是</em>;保存重要的量子信息，因此我们需要一种新的泄漏消除方法，以尽量减少对计算基础状态的干扰。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;轻轻消除泄漏</h2>; <p>;我们引入了一种新的量子操作，称为<em>;数据量子位泄漏消除（DQLR），其目标是数据量子位中的泄漏状态，并将其转换为数据量子位和相邻测量量子位中的计算状态。 DQLR 由两个量子位门组成（称为<em>;Leakage iSWAP</em>; - 一个<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_quantum_logic_gates#Clifford_qubit_gates:~:text=1%5D% 5B6%5D-,Imaginary%20swap,-2">;iSWAP</a>; 具有泄漏状态的操作）受到 CZ 门的启发并与之类似，然后快速重置测量量子位以进一步消除错误。 Leakage iSWAP 门非常高效，并且极大地受益于我们在表面代码实验中对 CZ 门的广泛表征和校准。 </p>; <p>; 回想一下，CZ 门对两个不同的量子位进行两次单次激励，并短暂地将它们带到一个量子位，然后将它们返回到各自的量子位。泄漏 iSWAP 门的操作类似，但几乎相反，因此它需要具有两个激励的单个量子位（也称为 |2⟩），并将它们分成两个量子位上的 |1⟩。泄漏 iSWAP 门（就此而言，CZ 门）特别有效，因为如果存在少于两个激励，它不会对量子位进行操作。我们正在精确地移除 |2⟩ <em>;Jenga</em>; 砖块，而不会推倒整个塔。 </p>; <p>; 通过仔细测量 Transmon 网格上的泄漏状态总体，我们发现 DQLR 可以将所有量子位的平均泄漏状态总体减少至约 0.1%，而没有它时接近 1%。重要的是，我们不再观察到数据量子位的泄漏量逐渐增加，而在使用 DQLR 之前，这种情况总是在某种程度上存在。 </p>; <p>; 然而，这个结果只是谜题的一半。如前所述，诸如 MLR 之类的操作可用于有效消除数据量子位上的泄漏，但它也会完全擦除存储的量子态。我们还需要证明 DQLR 与逻辑量子态的保存兼容。 </p>; <p>; 难题的后半部分来自于在每个 QEC 周期结束时交错执行 QEC 实验，并观察逻辑性能。在这里，我们使用名为<em>;检测概率</em>;的指标来衡量我们执行 QEC 的情况。在存在泄漏的情况下，随着越来越多的量子位进入并保持泄漏状态，与时间和空间相关的错误将导致检测概率逐渐上升。当我们根本不执行重置时，这一点最为明显，这会迅速导致 transmon 网格受到泄漏的困扰，并且它无法用于 QEC 的目的。 </p>; <table align="center" J_UouNnqxvkmWzOYUm8Zp9DY4dWS3CZmYVddS9hNVMvZgrXA1djXw9LgzvE3hZjLyzSrvzLy1qR3_d76Tp9zfdUK_pEFaWBmCYO/s1532/image2.png"样式="左边距：自动；右边距：自动；">;<img border="0" data-original-height="802" com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgC7T3bILXM6tqNCbHKb04ZwJhdanfunDEFSSbXDTa5J2MyjOWLyCGfW-dEsSrmjIZJY3e0KfvdzVYQZidJniivyaCPGJ_UouNnqxvkmWzOYUm8Zp9DY4dWS3CZ mYVddS9hNVMvZgrXA1djXw9LgzvE3hZjLyzSrvzLy1qR3_d76Tp9zfdUK_pEFaWBmCYO/s16000/image2.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align : center;">;我们 QEC 实验中最先进的技术是在测量量子位上使用 MLR 来消除泄漏。虽然这使测量量子位（绿色圆圈）上的泄漏数量保持足够低，但数据量子位泄漏数量（绿色方块）将增长并饱和到几个百分点。使用 DQLR，测量（蓝色圆圈）和数据量子位（蓝色方块）上的泄漏总体保持在可接受的低水平且稳定。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <p>; MLR，测量量子位上泄漏群体的大幅减少大大降低了检测概率，并在很大程度上缓解了逐渐上升的趋势。即使我们花费更多时间专门用于 MLR 门，但当可能发生其他错误时，检测概率也会降低。换句话说，泄漏在网格上引起的相关错误可能比等待空闲的量子位产生的不相关错误更具破坏性，对于我们来说，用前者换后者是非常值得的。 </p>; <p>; 当仅使用 MLR 时，我们观察到检测概率出现小幅但持续的残余上升。我们将检测概率的这种残余增加归因于数据量子位上的泄漏累积，并发现当我们实现 DQLR 时它就消失了。同样，与仅使用 MLR 相比，检测概率最终较低的观察结果表明，我们添加的操作消除了破坏性错误机制，同时最大限度地引入了不相关错误。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 鉴于这些有希望的结果，我们渴望在未来的 QEC 实验中实现 DQLR，我们期望外部的错误机制随着我们使用越来越大的传输网格，泄漏将得到极大改善，并且对泄漏的敏感性将得到增强。特别是，我们的模拟表明，表面代码的扩展几乎肯定需要大幅降低泄漏生成率，或者对所有量子位采用主动泄漏消除技术，例如 DQLR。 </p>; <p>; 通过了解泄漏产生的位置、捕获泄漏在 Transmon 网格中出现后的动态以及表明我们在 DQLR 中拥有有效的缓解策略，奠定了基础，我们相信泄漏及其相关错误不再对在大型传输量子比特网格上执行表面代码 QEC 协议的前景构成生存威胁。由于展示 QEC 的工作面临的挑战减少了，通往有用的量子计算机的道路从未如此有希望。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;致谢</h2>; schema="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="深度学习">;</ category>;<category schema="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Machine Learning">;</category>;<title type="text">;高效变压器的交替更新</stitle>; <content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;发布者：Google Research 软件工程师 Xin Wang 和研究科学家 Nishanth Dikkala</span>; <img src="https://blogger. googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEg68VOGvAuGk6w6db-De6SNc2OstzYrfUaCY4c03VVn_hAVb-wVsqk5zy07izav41UP3ZpurAn5kUs5QAJSzMU7Y_4en5TInN_0DA6iC8rUqAO0qmnwZXW ll7yZyWvL_1HndCAtk7USVEyNxrXezwlmWDfrtQsEsQhnfjNkYvkoK5QiSIXESnXcxGvTOeKk/s1600/altup.png" style="显示：无；" />; <p>; 当代深度学习模型在从自然语言到计算机视觉的许多领域都取得了巨大的成功。 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transformer_(machine_learning_model)">;变压器神经网络</a>;（变压器）是一种流行的深度学习架构，如今构成了大多数自然语言任务的基础处理，并开始扩展到其他领域的应用程序，例如<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2010.11929">;计算机视觉</a>;、<a href="https://blog .research.google/2023/03/palm-e-embodied-multimodal-language.html">;机器人</a>;和<a href="https://wayve.ai/thinking/lingo-natural-language-自动驾驶/">;自动驾驶</a>;。此外，它们构成了所有当前最先进的<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Language_model">;语言模型</a>;的支柱。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; Transformer 网络规模的不断扩大带来了性能的提高和<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.07682">;的出现较小网络中不存在的行为</a>;。然而，这种规模的增加往往伴随着计算成本和推理延迟的急剧增加。一个自然的问题是我们是否可以在不增加计算负担的情况下获得更大模型的好处。 </p>; <p>; 在“<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.13310">;高效变压器的交替更新</a>;”中，在 <a href="https: //neurips.cc/virtual/2023/poster/72994">;NeurIPS 2023</a>;，我们引入了 AltUp，一种在不增加计算成本的情况下利用增加的令牌表示的方法。 AltUp 易于实现，广泛适用于任何变压器架构，并且需要最少的<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperparameter_optimization">;超参数调整</a>;。例如，在 770M 参数 T5-Large 模型上使用 AltUp 的变体，添加约 100 个参数会产生质量明显更好的模型。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;背景</h2>; <p>; 为了了解如何实现这一目标，我们深入研究了 Transformer 的工作原理工作。首先，他们将输入划分为一系列标记。然后，每个标记都映射到一个嵌入向量（通过嵌入表），称为标记嵌入。我们将该向量的维度称为标记表示维度。然后，Transformer 通过使用其网络参数应用一系列计算模块（称为层<em>;）</em>;来对这个令牌嵌入序列进行操作。每个转换器层中的参数数量是该层宽度的函数，该宽度由令牌表示维度决定。 </p>; <p>; 为了在不产生计算负担的情况下实现规模效益，先前的工作例如稀疏专家混合（Sparse MoE）模型（例如，<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs /2101.03961">;开关变压器</a>;，<a href="https://blog.research.google/2022/11/mixture-of-experts-with-expert-choice.html?m=1">;专家选择</a>;，<a href="https://blog.research.google/2022/01/scaling-vision-with-sparse-mixture-of.html?m=1">;V-MoE</a >;）主要专注于通过有条件地激活基于输入的子集。这使我们能够在不显着增加每个输入的计算量的情况下扩大网络规模。然而，通过有条件地激活部分令牌表示向量来扩大令牌表示维度本身还存在研究空白。 </p>; <p>; 最近的工作（例如，<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2001.08361">;缩放法则</a>;和<a href="https://arxiv.org /abs/2011.14522">;无限宽度网络</a>;已经从经验和理论上证明，更宽的令牌表示有助于学习更复杂的函数。这种现象在功能不断增加的现代建筑中也很明显。例如，在 <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1910.10683 中，表示维度从 512（小）增长到 768（基本）和 1024（分别对应于具有 770M、3B 和 11B 参数的模型） ">;T5 型号</a>;，以及 <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2204.02311">;PaLM 型号</a>; 中的 4096 (8B) 到 8192 (64B) 和 18432 (540B) 。加宽的表示维度还显着提高了双编码器检索模型的性能。然而，天真地扩大表示向量需要相应地增加模型维度，这会以二次方的方式<sup id="fnref1">;<a href="#fn1" rel="footnote">;1</a>;</sup>;增加前馈计算中的计算量。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;方法</h2>; <p>; AltUp 的工作原理是将加宽的表示向量划分为大小相等的块，每层仅处理一个块，并使用有效的预测校正机制来推断其他块的输出（如下右图所示）。这使得 AltUp 能够同时保持模型维度（即计算成本）大致恒定，并利用增加的令牌维度。增加的令牌维度允许模型将更多信息打包到每个令牌的嵌入中。通过保持每个变压器层的宽度恒定，AltUp 避免了计算成本的二次增加，否则这种计算成本会随着表示的简单扩展而出现。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiA3Jus4rPOjc_P58AjvIw6pUlQn8O4H828q_VFXYW2-dHxVQbfrMtplwmTy-s8gPCQTg4_Cd5mOrxZHGK hFswEC3gjGs_ffzRsBLkbyzDUDiRDUe1OncBGayjX4JVpfNNTtG8RVu3r9MYaG0nx1TxzeLGvZhxKC5ySlN8GTR1LN5rSvwXIdkqGEaCvuegv/s1367/image2.png"样式="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="823" data-original-width="1367" src="https://blogger. googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiA3Jus4rPOjc_P58AjvIw6pUlQn8O4H828q_VFXYW2-dHxVQbfrMtplwmTy-s8gPCQTg4_Cd5mOrxZHGKhFswEC3gjGs_ffzRsBLkbyzDUDiRDUe 1OncBGayjX4JVpfNNTtG8RVu3r9MYaG0nx1TxzeLGvZhxKC5ySlN8GTR1LN5rSvwXIdkqGEaCvuegv/s16000/image2.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style= "text-align: center;">;不使用（<b>;左</b>;）和使用 AltUp（<b>;右</b>;）来加宽标记表示的图示。由于层宽度的增加，这种加宽导致普通变压器中的计算量几乎呈二次方增加。相比之下，交替更新保持层宽度恒定，并通过对每层表示的子块进行操作来有效地计算输出。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>; 更具体地说，每一层的输入是两个或多个块，其中一个被传递到 1x 宽度的转换器层（见下图）。我们将此块称为“激活”块。此计算会产生激活块的精确输出。同时，我们调用一个轻量级预测器来计算所有输入块的加权组合。预测值以及激活块的计算值被传递到轻量级校正器，该校正器根据观测值更新预测。这种校正机制使得未激活的块能够根据激活的块进行更新。预测和校正步骤仅涉及有限数量的向量加法和乘法，因此比常规变换器层快得多。我们注意到这个过程可以推广到任意数量的块。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a /tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>; 在更高的层面上，AltUp 与稀疏 MoE 类似，因为它是一种以条件访问（外部）参数的形式向模型添加容量的方法。在稀疏 MoE 中，附加参数采用前馈网络（FFN）专家的形式，并且条件是相对于输入的。在 AltUp 中，外部参数来自加宽的嵌入表，条件性采用表示向量交替分块激活的形式，如上图所示。因此，AltUp 与稀疏 MoE 模型具有相同的基础。 </p>; <p>; AltUp 相对于稀疏 MoE 的优势在于它不需要分片，因为引入的附加参数数量是一个因素<sup id="fnref2">;<a href="#fn2" rel=" footnote">;2</a>;</sup>; 的嵌入表大小，通常只占整个模型大小的一小部分。此外，由于 AltUp 专注于有条件地激活更广泛令牌表示的部分，因此它可以与 MoE 等正交技术协同应用，以获得互补的性能增益。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;评估</h2>; <p>; AltUp 在各种基准语言任务的 T5 模型上进行评估。在相同精度下，使用 AltUp 增强的模型均比外推密集模型更快。例如，我们观察到使用 AltUp 增强的 T5 Large 模型在 <a href="https://gluebenchmark.com/">;GLUE</a>; 上的速度分别提高了 27%、39%、87% 和 29% 、<a href="https://super.gluebenchmark.com/">;SuperGLUE</a>;、<a href="https://rajpurkar.github.io/SQuAD-explorer/">;SQuAD</a>; ，和 <a href="https://nlp.cs.washington.edu/triviaqa/">;Trivia-QA</a>; 基准。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; = T5 XL 型号）。</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>;当我们将 AltUp 应用于更大的模型时，它的相对性能会有所提高 - 将 T5 Base + AltUp 的相对加速与 T5 Large + AltUp 的相对加速进行比较。这证明了 AltUp 的可扩展性及其在更大模型上的改进性能。总体而言，在所有评估的模型大小和基准上，AltUp 始终导致模型比相应的基线模型具有更好的预测性能，并且速度相同。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;扩展：回收 AltUp</h2>; <p>; AltUp 配方添加了微量的 per-然而，层计算确实需要使用更宽的嵌入表。在词汇量大小（即分词器可以生成的不同标记的数量）非常大的某些场景中，这可能会导致初始嵌入查找和最终 <a href="https Recycled-AltUp 不需要扩展嵌入表维度，因此用它增强的模型实际上具有与基线模型相同数量的可训练参数。与密集基线相比，我们再次观察到持续的改进。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;AltUp 为什么起作用？</h2>; <p>; AltUp 通过添加和 <高效地利用嵌入表的辅助参数，并维持跨层的更高维度表示。我们认为，此计算的关键要素在于 AltUp 的预测机制，该机制执行不同块的集成。这种加权组合使得消息能够连续传递到整个向量，尽管只激活每层中的子块。另一方面，Recycled-AltUp 不会向令牌嵌入添加任何额外的参数。然而，它仍然具有在更高维表示空间中模拟计算的优点，因为当从一个变换器层移动到另一层时，会保持更高维表示向量。我们推测这通过增强网络中的信息流来帮助训练。一个有趣的研究方向是探索 Recycled-AltUp 的好处是否可以完全通过更有利的训练动态来解释。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; style="display: none;" />; <p>; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cluster_analysis">;Clustering</a>; is a fundamental, ubiquitous problem in data mining and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unsupervised_learning">;unsupervised</a>; machine learning, where the goal is to group together similar items. The standard forms of clustering are metric clustering and graph clustering. In metric clustering, a given metric space defines distances between data points, which are grouped together based on their <em>;separation</em>;. In graph clustering, a given graph connects similar data points through edges, and the clustering process groups data points together based on the <em>;connections</em>; between them. Both clustering forms are particularly useful for large corpora where class labels can't be defined. Examples of such corpora are the ever-growing digital text collections of various internet platforms, with applications including organizing and searching documents, identifying patterns in text, and recommending relevant documents to users (see more examples in the following posts: <a href="https://blog.research.google/2010/10/clustering-related-queries-based-on.html?m=1">;clustering related queries based on user intent</a>; and <a href="https://blog.research.google/2021/10/practical-differentially-private.html">;practical differentially private clustering</a>;). </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; The choice of text clustering method often presents a dilemma. One approach is to use embedding models, such as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BERT_(language_model)">;BERT</a>; or <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1907.11692">;RoBERTa</a>;, to define a metric clustering problem. Another is to utilize <a href="https://medium.com/@geetkal67/attention-networks-a-simple-way-to-understand-cross-attention-3b396266d82e">;cross-attention</a>; (CA) models, such as <a href="https://blog.research.google/2022/04/pathways-language-model-palm-scaling-to.html">;PaLM</a>; or <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generative_pre-trained_transformer">;GPT</a>;, to define a graph clustering problem. CA models can provide highly accurate similarity scores, but constructing the input graph may require a prohibitive quadratic number of inference calls to the model. On the other hand, a metric space can efficiently be defined by distances of embeddings produced by embedding models. However, these similarity distances are typically of substantial lower-quality compared to the similarity signals of CA models, and hence the produced clustering can be of much lower-quality. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>; <td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiRHbZ9egdnFlc6ZCmLeODTdPZoOXcjjEGCLHP8Ve3aihMExIjyLiX4n0Zy9l4nmkx-3k6rxYN5696irWyubaYAqecpxFTmP1wzjBo0MKnZMnnTjQrdSxKIWGzsySs8XB-OVHyyxKJBWI0dlrYvb_S204S6aSbkPTx8_FQTJXk8f_WDIoGgqNJTACuXNewu/s835/figure%20top.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="641" data-original-width="835" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiRHbZ9egdnFlc6ZCmLeODTdPZoOXcjjEGCLHP8Ve3aihMExIjyLiX4n0Zy9l4nmkx-3k6rxYN5696irWyubaYAqecpxFTmP1wzjBo0MKnZMnnTjQrdSxKIWGzsySs8XB-OVHyyxKJBWI0dlrYvb_S204S6aSbkPTx8_FQTJXk8f_WDIoGgqNJTACuXNewu/s16000/figure%20top.png" />;</a>;</td>; <td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjoY4juklU42gca4fdtnUN4t5j8Z-4rEEhyphenhyphenDi4kRfkV1wfqBs_wyldX9sU2pwtMHdVZPZf2vWnDweEPzwiLseYZenC3afIuaDRf_7arpoF-xnMAwgGXs48a_3wNG2trhN0CTkHgMVa6ZQ7ToP7IE6fpIFmbTF7YYGPFgYU3cMtyyBYIfSWVLVvRXY6Dueiy/s835/figure%20bottom.png" style="margin-left: auto;
